name: Amazigh Music
description: Music of the Amazigh people, the indigenous people of Northwest Africa (with main hubs in Morocco and Algeria) and certain parts of West Africa.

children.name: Ahwash
children.description: Associated with the Tashelhit-speaking peoples of southern and central Morocco, and performed in large groups, combining singing, poetry and drumming.

children.name: Izlan
children.description: Uses sung poetry with a focus on love themes.

children.name: Kabyle Music
children.description: Music of the Kabyle Amazigh people.

children.name: Sahrawi Music
children.description: Music of the Sahrawi people, an ethnic group who inhabit the westernmost areas of the Sahara Desert.

children.name: Sta√Øfi
children.description: Festive Chaoui genre that mixes local rural music with the zendali rhythm and modern instruments.

children.name: Tuareg Music
children.description: Amazigh Music by the nomadic Tuareg people who live through the Saharan desert in North Africa, encompassing various types of traditions and popular styles.
